basics.name: Blaine Wataru
basics.label: Student
basics.summary: I am studying for a B.S. in Computer Science in the Department of Information and Computer Sciences at the University of Hawaii. I expect to graduate in Spring, 2019.

education.institution: University of Hawaii at Manoa, Honolulu, HI

work.company: Information Technology Services at University of Hawaii at Manoa
work.summary: Worked primarily on the UHGroupings API, which is based off and uses Internet2's Grouper API.
highlights: Implemented  a new REST API to better reflect RESTful concepts.
Wrote multitudes of test code, and performed bug fixes to ensure the codebase runs properly.
Developed new API functionalities including the ability to get user's attributes based on their username.

work.company: International Structural Engineering and Construction Society
work.summary: Copyedit manuscripts for various ISEC conferences.
highlights: Copyedited manuscripts to fit ISEC guidelines.
Performed various odd jobs and testing for ISEC website.
Managed all final edited versions of manuscripts before they were sent to printer.

work.summary: Helped with various odd jobs in HR department.
highlights: Assisted with FICOH company events and wellness programs.
Performed a variety of odd jobs, including scanning, flyer construction and printing, filing, and research.

awards.title: Dean's List
awards.summary: Rewarded to students over a 3.5 GPA. Was awarded in both Spring and Fall 2016, Fall 2017, and Spring 2018.
